item.title: Here are our first Xbox Game Pass games for August
item.content:encoded:
Assassin's Creed Mirage! Rain World! More!

Microsoft has announced the first batch of games coming to its Xbox Game Pass subscription service this August.

Below are all the new games coming to Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass, Game Pass Standard in the coming weeks.

Available now:

  • Rain World (Cloud, Console, and PC), via Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass, Game Pass Standard

August 6th:

  • Citizen Sleeper 2: Starward Vector (Xbox Series X/S), Now with Game Pass Standard
  • Lonely Mountains: Snow Riders (Xbox Series X/S), Now with Game Pass Standard
  • MechWarrior 5: Clans (Xbox Series X/S), Now with Game Pass Standard
  • Orcs Must Die! Deathtrap (Xbox Series X/S), Now with Game Pass Standard

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

August 7th:

  • Assassin's Creed Mirage (Cloud, Console, and PC), via Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass

August 12th:

  • Aliens: Fireteam Elite (Cloud, Console, and PC), via Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass, Game Pass Standard

August 14th:

  • 9 Kings (Game Preview) (PC), via Game Pass Ultimate, PC Game Pass

A highlight with this batch of games is Assassin's Creed Mirage, which Christian Donlan called "a rich and characterful adventure".

"Through the warmth of familiar rituals returning after those bigger, rangier games, I get to see what's really special about this series, what it takes to create, perhaps, and what it can give us in return," reads Eurogamer's four star Assassin's Creed Mirage review.

Further details on this month's offerings can be found via Xbox.

As with every month, with the arrival of new games, other titles will be leaving Xbox Game Pass. The following games will be leaving Game Pass on 15th August:

  • Anthem (Console and PC) EA Play
  • Farming Simulator 22 (Cloud, Console, and PC)
  • Persona 3 Reload (Cloud, Console, and PC)

If you want to keep playing these games after they leave Game Pass, you'll need to purchase them. On the plus side, Game Pass subscribers get a 20 percent discount.

For everything else in Microsoft's subscription service, you can check out our handy Xbox Game Pass guide detailing the many titles available.

item.title: Sound the Silksong klaxon! There's another Nintendo indie showcase coming this week
item.content:encoded:
Nintendo's being as coy as always.

Silksong fans, prepare to ride the rollercoaster of delirious anticipation and potential crushing disappointment once more: Nintendo has announced another indie-focused showcase is happening this week, so could this finally be the day for that release date news?

More specifically, Nintendo's Indie World showcase - as these things are officially known - airs this Thursday, 7th August, at 2pm in the UK. If you're over in yonder US, it's a considerably earlier start, with things kicking off at 6am PT or 9am ET.

As to what we can expect this time around, Nintendo's being as coy as always. However, it is promising "roughly 15 minutes of new announcements and updates" regarding indie titles for both Switch and Switch 2. And if that appeals, you can watch the whole thing on YouTube.

A release date for Silksong - developer Team Cherry's massively anticipated Hollow Knight sequel - is, of course, the great hope this time around, especially given the excitement generated by its reappearance in Nintendo's Switch 2 showcase back in April.

Anticipation for the title - and frustration over the continuing lack of a release date - has now reached such a fever pitch other developers are savvily starting to get in on the action. Earlier this month, indie developer Pere Albacar promised social media followers a free Steam code for his upcoming release Sands of Hope if Silksong made last week's third-party focused Nintendo showcase. In the end it didn't show up, but there's always next time - which just happens to be this Thursday.

If you're curious about what else is coming to Nintendo Switch consoles, you may also like to know that there'll be a separate Showcase in Japan, where the Indie presentation will be an extra five minutes long - these bonus minutes are usually home to some pretty cool stuff, so we will make sure to watch this, too, and bring you any extra information you need.
